page.title: 07THE VILLAGES OF ORCHESTON
page.content: The twin villages of Orcheston St. George and St. Mary are quiet isolated communities because they are some distance away from the main roads that cross Salisbury Plain. Although the first bus service was pioneered from Orcheston in 1912, they have a service every two or three hours run by the Bristol Omnibus Co. travelling between Bath and Salisbury. Looking down over the village from the Gibbet, you will notice the abundance of trees, mainly deciduous, scattered around the various properties, and the bare stretches of grassland in contrast. The famous Orcheston grass grows to a height of 12 feet and when the meadows are flooded in Winter the grass can be seen growing above the water level. Orcheston would be an ideal place to live but for the nearby Army Ranges.
